title: Getting Started with AI Tools: A Plain-English Guide
subtitle: What to try first, how to evaluate, and common mistakes to avoid.
author: Team AI Tools Compare
excerpt: New to AI tools? This no-jargon guide shows you how to pick your first tool, test it quickly, and avoid wasted time.
contentHtml:
Why start now?

AI tools can save hours per week if you deploy them deliberately. Start small, measure results, then scale.

Quick plan

  1. Pick one task to automate (email drafts, transcripts, design variations).
  2. Choose 2 tools max to test for that task.
  3. Run a 20â€“30 minute head-to-head.
  4. Keep the winner, set a weekly cadence, measure gain.

Common mistakes

  • Trying 10 tools at once.
  • No before/after time tracking.
  • Ignoring data ownership and privacy.

title: Text AI Shootout: ChatGPT vs Claude (Clarity, Speed, Cost)
subtitle: We compare writing quality, hallucinations, context, and pricing.
author: Team AI Tools Compare
excerpt: Which text AI should you pick for everyday work? We tested clarity, speed, and context handling on real tasks.
contentHtml:
How we tested

We used the same prompts across email, analysis, and coding tasks with equal temperature and length.

Results

  • Clarity: Claude
  • Speed: ChatGPT
  • Context length: Claude

Both are great; choose based on task and budget.

title: Buying an Image AI: The 12-Point Checklist
subtitle: From style control to licensing and export formats.
author: Team AI Tools Compare
excerpt: Before you pay, check these 12 things: style control, upscaling, licensing, privacy, and integration.
contentHtml:
What to check

  1. Style consistency
  2. Prompt controls
  3. Commercial licensing
  4. Export sizes and formats
  5. API availability
  6. Community & support
